trans-unit.source: The Local Configuration Manager (LCM) is the engine of Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC).
trans-unit.target: The Local Configuration Manager (LCM) is the engine of Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC).

trans-unit.source: The LCM runs on every target node, and is responsible for parsing and enacting configurations that are sent to the node.
trans-unit.target: The LCM runs on every target node, and is responsible for parsing and enacting configurations that are sent to the node.

trans-unit.source: It is also responsible for a number of other aspects of DSC, including the following.
trans-unit.target: It is also responsible for a number of other aspects of DSC, including the following.

trans-unit.source: Specifying how often a node pulls and enacts configurations.
trans-unit.target: Specifying how often a node pulls and enacts configurations.

trans-unit.source: Associating the node with pull servers.
trans-unit.target: Associating the node with pull servers.

trans-unit.source: You use a special type of configuration to configure the LCM to specify each of these behaviors.
trans-unit.target: You use a special type of configuration to configure the LCM to specify each of these behaviors.

trans-unit.source: The following sections describe how to configure the LCM.
trans-unit.target: The following sections describe how to configure the LCM.

trans-unit.source: **Note**: This topic applies to the LCM introduced in Windows PowerShell 5.0.
trans-unit.target: **Note**: This topic applies to the LCM introduced in Windows PowerShell 5.0.

trans-unit.source: For information about configuring the LCM in Windows PowerShell 4.0, see Windows PowerShell 4.0 Desired State Configuration Local Configuration Manager.
trans-unit.target: For information about configuring the LCM in Windows PowerShell 4.0, see Windows PowerShell 4.0 Desired State Configuration Local Configuration Manager.

trans-unit.source: Writing and enacting an LCM configuration
trans-unit.target: Writing and enacting an LCM configuration

trans-unit.source: To configure the LCM, you create and run a special type of configuration.
trans-unit.target: To configure the LCM, you create and run a special type of configuration.

trans-unit.source: To specify an LCM configuration, you use the DscLocalConfigurationManager attribute.
trans-unit.target: To specify an LCM configuration, you use the DscLocalConfigurationManager attribute.

trans-unit.source: The following shows a simple configuration that sets the LCM to push mode.
trans-unit.target: The following shows a simple configuration that sets the LCM to push mode.

trans-unit.source: You call and run the configuration to create the configuration MOF, just as you would a normal configuration (for information on creating the configuration MOF, see Get Started with Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration).
trans-unit.target: You call and run the configuration to create the configuration MOF, just as you would a normal configuration (for information on creating the configuration MOF, see Get Started with Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration).

trans-unit.source: Unlike normal configurations, you do not enact an LCM configuration by calling the [Start-DscConfiguration](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn521623.aspx) cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Unlike normal configurations, you do not enact an LCM configuration by calling the [Start-DscConfiguration](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn521623.aspx) cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Instead, you call the Set-DscLocalConfigurationManager cmdlet, supplying the path to the configuration MOF as a parameter.
trans-unit.target: Instead, you call the Set-DscLocalConfigurationManager cmdlet, supplying the path to the configuration MOF as a parameter.

trans-unit.source: After you enact the configuration, you can see the properties of the LCM by calling the [Get-DscLocalConfigurationManager](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn407378.aspx) cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: After you enact the configuration, you can see the properties of the LCM by calling the [Get-DscLocalConfigurationManager](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn407378.aspx) cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: An LCM configuration can contain blocks only for a limited set of resources.
trans-unit.target: An LCM configuration can contain blocks only for a limited set of resources.

trans-unit.source: In the previous example, the only resource called is **Settings**.
trans-unit.target: In the previous example, the only resource called is **Settings**.

trans-unit.source: **ConfigurationRepositoryWeb**: specifies an HTTP pull server for configurations.
trans-unit.target: **ConfigurationRepositoryWeb**: specifies an HTTP pull server for configurations.

trans-unit.source: **ConfigurationRepositoryShare**: specifies an SMB pull server for configurations.
trans-unit.target: **ConfigurationRepositoryShare**: specifies an SMB pull server for configurations.

trans-unit.source: **ResourceRepositoryWeb**: specifies an HTTP pull server for modules.
trans-unit.target: **ResourceRepositoryWeb**: specifies an HTTP pull server for modules.

trans-unit.source: **ResourceRepositoryShare**: specifies an SMB pull server for modules.
trans-unit.target: **ResourceRepositoryShare**: specifies an SMB pull server for modules.

trans-unit.source: **ReportServerWeb**: specifies an HTTP pull server to which reports are sent.
trans-unit.target: **ReportServerWeb**: specifies an HTTP pull server to which reports are sent.

trans-unit.source: Other than specifying pull servers and partial configurations, all of the properties of the LCM are configured in a **Settings** block.
trans-unit.target: Other than specifying pull servers and partial configurations, all of the properties of the LCM are configured in a **Settings** block.

trans-unit.source: The following properties are available in a **Settings** block.
trans-unit.target: The following properties are available in a **Settings** block.

trans-unit.source: How often, in minutes, the current configuration is checked and applied.
trans-unit.target: How often, in minutes, the current configuration is checked and applied.

trans-unit.source: This property is ignored if the ConfigurationMode property is set to ApplyOnly.
trans-unit.target: This property is ignored if the ConfigurationMode property is set to ApplyOnly.

trans-unit.source: __Note__: Either the value of this property must be a multiple of the value of the __RefreshFrequencyMins__ property, or the value of the __RefreshFrequencyMins__ property must be a multiple of the value of this property.
trans-unit.target: __Note__: Either the value of this property must be a multiple of the value of the __RefreshFrequencyMins__ property, or the value of the __RefreshFrequencyMins__ property must be a multiple of the value of this property.

trans-unit.source: Set this to __$true__ to automatically reboot the node after a configuration that requires reboot is applied.
trans-unit.target: Set this to __$true__ to automatically reboot the node after a configuration that requires reboot is applied.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, you will have to manually reboot the node for any configuration that requires it.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, you will have to manually reboot the node for any configuration that requires it.

trans-unit.source: Specifies how the LCM actually applies the configuration to the target nodes.
trans-unit.target: Specifies how the LCM actually applies the configuration to the target nodes.

trans-unit.source: It can take the following values: __"ApplyOnly"__: DSC applies the configuration and does nothing further unless a new configuration is pushed to the target node or when a new configuration is pulled from a server.
trans-unit.target: It can take the following values: __"ApplyOnly"__: DSC applies the configuration and does nothing further unless a new configuration is pushed to the target node or when a new configuration is pulled from a server.

trans-unit.source: After initial application of a new configuration, DSC does not check for drift from a previously configured state.
trans-unit.target: After initial application of a new configuration, DSC does not check for drift from a previously configured state.

trans-unit.source: The LCM applies any new configurations.
trans-unit.target: The LCM applies any new configurations.

trans-unit.source: After initial application of a new configuration, if the target node drifts from the desired state, DSC reports the discrepancy in logs __"ApplyAndAutoCorrect"__: DSC applies any new configurations.
trans-unit.target: After initial application of a new configuration, if the target node drifts from the desired state, DSC reports the discrepancy in logs __"ApplyAndAutoCorrect"__: DSC applies any new configurations.

trans-unit.source: After initial application of a new configuration, if the target node drifts from the desired state, DSC reports the discrepancy in logs, and then re-applies the current configuration.
trans-unit.target: After initial application of a new configuration, if the target node drifts from the desired state, DSC reports the discrepancy in logs, and then re-applies the current configuration.

trans-unit.source: Specifies what happens after a reboot during the application of a configuration.
trans-unit.target: Specifies what happens after a reboot during the application of a configuration.

trans-unit.source: The possible values are as follows: __"ContinueConfiguration"__: Continue applying the current configuration.__"StopConfiguraiton"__: Stop the current configuration.
trans-unit.target: The possible values are as follows: __"ContinueConfiguration"__: Continue applying the current configuration.__"StopConfiguraiton"__: Stop the current configuration.

trans-unit.source: Specifies how the LCM gets configurations.
trans-unit.target: Specifies how the LCM gets configurations.

trans-unit.source: The possible values are as follows: __"Disabled"__: DSC configurations are disabled for this node.
trans-unit.target: The possible values are as follows: __"Disabled"__: DSC configurations are disabled for this node.

trans-unit.source: __"Push"__: Configurations are initiated by calling the Start-DscConfiguration cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: __"Push"__: Configurations are initiated by calling the Start-DscConfiguration cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: The configuration is applied immediately to the node.
trans-unit.target: The configuration is applied immediately to the node.

trans-unit.source: __Pull:__ The node is configured to regularly check for configurations from a pull server.
trans-unit.target: __Pull:__ The node is configured to regularly check for configurations from a pull server.

trans-unit.source: If this property is set to Pull, you must specify a pull server in a __ConfigurationRepositoryWeb__ or __ConfigurationRepositoryShare__ block.
trans-unit.target: If this property is set to Pull, you must specify a pull server in a __ConfigurationRepositoryWeb__ or __ConfigurationRepositoryShare__ block.

trans-unit.source: For more information about pull servers, see [Setting up a DSC pull server](pullServer.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about pull servers, see [Setting up a DSC pull server](pullServer.md).

trans-unit.source: A GUID that specifies a certificate used to secure credentials for access to the configuration.
trans-unit.target: A GUID that specifies a certificate used to secure credentials for access to the configuration.

trans-unit.source: For more information see [Want to secure credentials in Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/powershell/archive/2014/01/31/want-to-secure-credentials-in-windows-powershell-desired-state-configuration.aspx)?.
trans-unit.target: For more information see [Want to secure credentials in Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/powershell/archive/2014/01/31/want-to-secure-credentials-in-windows-powershell-desired-state-configuration.aspx)?.

trans-unit.source: A GUID that identifies the configuration file to get from a pull server in pull mode.
trans-unit.target: A GUID that identifies the configuration file to get from a pull server in pull mode.

trans-unit.source: The node will pull configurations on the pull sever if the name of the configuration MOF is named ConfigurationID.mof.
trans-unit.target: The node will pull configurations on the pull sever if the name of the configuration MOF is named ConfigurationID.mof.

trans-unit.source: __Note:__ If you set this property, registering the node with a pull server by using __RegistryKeys__ and does not work.
trans-unit.target: __Note:__ If you set this property, registering the node with a pull server by using __RegistryKeys__ and does not work.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Setting up a pull client with configuration names](pullClientConfigNames.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Setting up a pull client with configuration names](pullClientConfigNames.md).

trans-unit.source: The time interval, in minutes, at which the LCM checks a pull server to get updated configurations.
trans-unit.target: The time interval, in minutes, at which the LCM checks a pull server to get updated configurations.

trans-unit.source: This value is ignored if the LCM is not configured in pull mode.
trans-unit.target: This value is ignored if the LCM is not configured in pull mode.

trans-unit.source: __Note:__ Either the value of this property must be a multiple of the value of the __ConfigurationModeFrequencyMins__ property, or the value of the __ConfigurationModeFrequencyMins__ property must be a multiple of the value of this property.
trans-unit.target: __Note:__ Either the value of this property must be a multiple of the value of the __ConfigurationModeFrequencyMins__ property, or the value of the __ConfigurationModeFrequencyMins__ property must be a multiple of the value of this property.

trans-unit.source: __$TRUE__ if new configurations downloaded from the configuration server are allowed to overwrite the old ones on the target node.
trans-unit.target: __$TRUE__ if new configurations downloaded from the configuration server are allowed to overwrite the old ones on the target node.

trans-unit.source:
This is the default and should be used in production scenarios.
  • Setting to __ForceModuleImport__, causes the LCM to reload any DSC resource modules, even if they have been previously loaded and cached.
trans-unit.target:
This is the default and should be used in production scenarios.
  • Setting to __ForceModuleImport__, causes the LCM to reload any DSC resource modules, even if they have been previously loaded and cached.

trans-unit.source: This impacts the performance of DSC operations as each module is reloaded on use.
trans-unit.target: This impacts the performance of DSC operations as each module is reloaded on use.

trans-unit.source:
Typically you would use this value while debugging a resource
  • In this release, __All__ is same as __ForceModuleImport__
trans-unit.target:
Typically you would use this value while debugging a resource
  • In this release, __All__ is same as __ForceModuleImport__

trans-unit.source: Use __ConfigurationRepositoryWeb__ and __ConfigurationRepositoryShare__ blocks to define configuration pull servers.
trans-unit.target: Use __ConfigurationRepositoryWeb__ and __ConfigurationRepositoryShare__ blocks to define configuration pull servers.

trans-unit.source: Use __ResourceRepositoryWeb__ and __ResourceRepositoryShare__ blocks to define resource pull servers.
trans-unit.target: Use __ResourceRepositoryWeb__ and __ResourceRepositoryShare__ blocks to define resource pull servers.

trans-unit.source: Use __ReportServerWeb__ blocks to define report pull servers.
trans-unit.target: Use __ReportServerWeb__ blocks to define report pull servers.

trans-unit.source: The number of days the LCM keeps the status of the current configuration.
trans-unit.target: The number of days the LCM keeps the status of the current configuration.

trans-unit.source: A pull server is either an OData web service or an SMB share that is used as a central location for DSC files.
trans-unit.target: A pull server is either an OData web service or an SMB share that is used as a central location for DSC files.

trans-unit.source: LCM configuration supports defining the following types of pull servers:
trans-unit.target: LCM configuration supports defining the following types of pull servers:

trans-unit.source: **Configuration server**: A repository for DSC configurations.
trans-unit.target: **Configuration server**: A repository for DSC configurations.

trans-unit.source: Define configuration severs by using **ConfigurationRepositoryWeb** (for web-based servers) and **ConfigurationRepositoryShare** (for SMB-based servers) blocks.
trans-unit.target: Define configuration severs by using **ConfigurationRepositoryWeb** (for web-based servers) and **ConfigurationRepositoryShare** (for SMB-based servers) blocks.

trans-unit.source: Resource server—A repository for DSC resources, packaged as PowerShell modules.
trans-unit.target: Resource server—A repository for DSC resources, packaged as PowerShell modules.

trans-unit.source: Define resource severs by using **ResourceRepositoryWeb** (for web-based servers) and **ResourceRepositoryShare** (for SMB-based servers) blocks.
trans-unit.target: Define resource severs by using **ResourceRepositoryWeb** (for web-based servers) and **ResourceRepositoryShare** (for SMB-based servers) blocks.

trans-unit.source: Report server—A service that DSC sends report data to.
trans-unit.target: Report server—A service that DSC sends report data to.

trans-unit.source: Define report servers by using **ReportServerWeb** blocks.
trans-unit.target: Define report servers by using **ReportServerWeb** blocks.

trans-unit.source: A report server must be a web service.
trans-unit.target: A report server must be a web service.

trans-unit.source: For information about setting up and using pull servers, see [Setting up a DSC pull server](pullServer.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about setting up and using pull servers, see [Setting up a DSC pull server](pullServer.md).

trans-unit.source: To define a web-based configuration sever, you create a **ConfigurationRepositoryWeb** block.
trans-unit.target: To define a web-based configuration sever, you create a **ConfigurationRepositoryWeb** block.

trans-unit.source: Set to **$TRUE** to allow connections from the node to the server without authentication.
trans-unit.target: Set to **$TRUE** to allow connections from the node to the server without authentication.

trans-unit.source: A GUID that represents the certificate used to authenticate to the server.
trans-unit.target: A GUID that represents the certificate used to authenticate to the server.

trans-unit.source: An array of names of configurations to be pulled by the target node.
trans-unit.target: An array of names of configurations to be pulled by the target node.

trans-unit.source: These are used only if the node is registered with the pull server by using a **RegistrationKey**.
trans-unit.target: These are used only if the node is registered with the pull server by using a **RegistrationKey**.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Setting up a pull client with configuration names](pullClientConfigNames.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Setting up a pull client with configuration names](pullClientConfigNames.md).

trans-unit.source: A GUID that registers the node with the pull server.
trans-unit.target: A GUID that registers the node with the pull server.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Setting up a pull client with configuration names](pullClientConfigNames.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Setting up a pull client with configuration names](pullClientConfigNames.md).

trans-unit.source: The URL of the configuration server.
trans-unit.target: The URL of the configuration server.

trans-unit.source: To define an SMB-based configuration server, you create a **ConfigurationRepositoryShare** block.
trans-unit.target: To define an SMB-based configuration server, you create a **ConfigurationRepositoryShare** block.

trans-unit.source: The credential used to authenticate to the SMB share.
trans-unit.target: The credential used to authenticate to the SMB share.

trans-unit.source: The path of the SMB share.
trans-unit.target: The path of the SMB share.

trans-unit.source: To define a web-based resource sever, you create a **ResourceRepositoryWeb** block.
trans-unit.target: To define a web-based resource sever, you create a **ResourceRepositoryWeb** block.

trans-unit.source: Set to **$TRUE** to allow connections from the node to the server without authentication.
trans-unit.target: Set to **$TRUE** to allow connections from the node to the server without authentication.

trans-unit.source: A GUID that represents the certificate used to authenticate to the server.
trans-unit.target: A GUID that represents the certificate used to authenticate to the server.

trans-unit.source: A GUID that identifies the node to the pull server.
trans-unit.target: A GUID that identifies the node to the pull server.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see How to register a node with a DSC pull server.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see How to register a node with a DSC pull server.

trans-unit.source: The URL of the configuration server.
trans-unit.target: The URL of the configuration server.

trans-unit.source: To define an SMB-based resource server, you create a **ResourceRepositoryShare** block.
trans-unit.target: To define an SMB-based resource server, you create a **ResourceRepositoryShare** block.

trans-unit.source: The credential used to authenticate to the SMB share.
trans-unit.target: The credential used to authenticate to the SMB share.

trans-unit.source: The path of the SMB share.
trans-unit.target: The path of the SMB share.

trans-unit.source: A report server must be an OData web service.
trans-unit.target: A report server must be an OData web service.

trans-unit.source: To define a report server, you create a **ReportServerWeb** block.
trans-unit.target: To define a report server, you create a **ReportServerWeb** block.

trans-unit.source: Set to **$TRUE** to allow connections from the node to the server without authentication.
trans-unit.target: Set to **$TRUE** to allow connections from the node to the server without authentication.

trans-unit.source: A GUID that represents the certificate used to authenticate to the server.
trans-unit.target: A GUID that represents the certificate used to authenticate to the server.

trans-unit.source: A GUID that identifies the node to the pull server.
trans-unit.target: A GUID that identifies the node to the pull server.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see How to register a node with a DSC pull server.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see How to register a node with a DSC pull server.

trans-unit.source: The URL of the configuration server.
trans-unit.target: The URL of the configuration server.

trans-unit.source: To define a partial configuration, you create a **PartialConfiguration** block.
trans-unit.target: To define a partial configuration, you create a **PartialConfiguration** block.

trans-unit.source: For more information about partial configurations, see [DSC Partial configurations](partialConfigs.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about partial configurations, see [DSC Partial configurations](partialConfigs.md).

trans-unit.source: An array of names of configuration servers, previously defined in **ConfiguratoinRepositoryWeb** and **ConfigurationRepositoryShare** blocks, where the partial configuration is pulled from.
trans-unit.target: An array of names of configuration servers, previously defined in **ConfiguratoinRepositoryWeb** and **ConfigurationRepositoryShare** blocks, where the partial configuration is pulled from.

trans-unit.source: A list of names of other configurations that must be completed before this partial configuration is applied.
trans-unit.target: A list of names of other configurations that must be completed before this partial configuration is applied.

trans-unit.source: Text used to describe the partial configuration.
trans-unit.target: Text used to describe the partial configuration.

trans-unit.source: An array of resources exclusive to this partial configuration.
trans-unit.target: An array of resources exclusive to this partial configuration.

trans-unit.source: Specifies how DCS gets this partial configuration..
trans-unit.target: Specifies how DCS gets this partial configuration..

trans-unit.source: The possible values are as follows: **Disabled**: This partial configuration is disabled.
trans-unit.target: The possible values are as follows: **Disabled**: This partial configuration is disabled.

trans-unit.source: **Push**: The partial configuration is pushed to the node by calling the [Publish-DscConfiguration](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/mt517875.aspx) cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: **Push**: The partial configuration is pushed to the node by calling the [Publish-DscConfiguration](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/mt517875.aspx) cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: After all partial configurations for the node are either pushed or pulled from a server, the configuration can be started by calling `Start-DscConfiguration –UseExisting`.
trans-unit.target: After all partial configurations for the node are either pushed or pulled from a server, the configuration can be started by calling `Start-DscConfiguration –UseExisting`.

trans-unit.source: **Pull**: The node is configured to regularly check for the partial configuration from a pull server.
trans-unit.target: **Pull**: The node is configured to regularly check for the partial configuration from a pull server.

trans-unit.source: If this property is set to "Pull", you must specify a pull server by setting the **ConfigurationSource** property.
trans-unit.target: If this property is set to "Pull", you must specify a pull server by setting the **ConfigurationSource** property.

trans-unit.source: For more information about pull servers, see [Setting up a DSC pull server](pullServer.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about pull servers, see [Setting up a DSC pull server](pullServer.md).

trans-unit.source: An array of the names of resource servers from which to download required resources for this partial configuration.
trans-unit.target: An array of the names of resource servers from which to download required resources for this partial configuration.

trans-unit.source: These names must refer to resource servers previously defined in **ResourceRepositoryWeb** and **ResourceRepositoryShare** blocks.
trans-unit.target: These names must refer to resource servers previously defined in **ResourceRepositoryWeb** and **ResourceRepositoryShare** blocks.

trans-unit.source: [Set-DscLocalConfigurationManager](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn521621.aspx) [Setting up a pull client with configuration names](pullClientConfigNames.md)
trans-unit.target: [Set-DscLocalConfigurationManager](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn521621.aspx) [Setting up a pull client with configuration names](pullClientConfigNames.md)
